attributes.action: Allow students to keep facial hair if they wish in private/state/grammar Schools
attributes.additional_details: It’s not fair on students when they start going through puberty and grow facial hair, then get told they aren’t allowed it. Students in Year 12 and 13 would of started to grow more facial hair than other years and some may want to keep their beards. It is also not fair on students if teachers are allowed to have them but not students. As long as the student keeps it neat and tidy, they should be allowed. Also shaving more frequently can damage the face and create spots and acne as some may have experienced.
attributes.background: To allow students to keep their facial hair, and to remove it as a rule.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for individual schools.
